title: MS AccessRound()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessRound()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Round the Price column to 1 decimal in the "Products" table:
SELECT ProductName, Price, Round(Price, 1) AS RoundedPrice
FROM Products;

Definition and Usage
The Round() function rounds a number to a specified number of decimal places.
Note:
If the expression ends with a 5, 
this function rounds so that the last digit is an even 
number. Here are some examples:
Round(34.55, 1) - Result: 34.6 (rounds up)
Round(34.65, 1) -
Result: 34.6 (rounds down)
Syntax
Round(
expression
,
decimal_places
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. A numeric expression to be rounded
decimal_places
Optional. The number of decimal places to round the expression to. If 
    omitted, the function rounds to the nearest whole number
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT ProductName, Price, Round(Price, 1) AS RoundedPrice
FROM Products;

quiz.question: What is this function rounds so that the last digit?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of this function rounds so that the last digit is 'an even 
number'.

quiz.question: What is Here?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Here is 'some examples:
Round(34'.

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessRound()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessRound()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessRound()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
